17 namespace voxblox {
18 
19 // A special type of layer just for containing the mesh. Same general interface
20 // as a layer of blocks, but only contains a single thing, not a set of voxels.
21 class MeshLayer {
22  public:
23  EIGEN_MAKE_ALIGNED_OPERATOR_NEW
24 
25  typedef std::shared_ptr<MeshLayer> Ptr;
26  typedef std::shared_ptr<const MeshLayer> ConstPtr;
27  typedef typename AnyIndexHashMapType<Mesh::Ptr>::type MeshMap;
28 
29  explicit MeshLayer(FloatingPoint block_size)
30  : block_size_(block_size), block_size_inv_(1.0 / block_size) {}
31  virtual ~MeshLayer() {}
32 
33  // By index.
34  inline const Mesh& getMeshByIndex(const BlockIndex& index) const {
35  typename MeshMap::const_iterator it = mesh_map_.find(index);
36  if (it != mesh_map_.end()) {
37  return *(it->second);
38  } else {
39  LOG(FATAL) << "Accessed unallocated mesh at " << index.transpose();
40  }
41  }
42 
43  inline Mesh& getMeshByIndex(const BlockIndex& index) {
44  typename MeshMap::iterator it = mesh_map_.find(index);
45  if (it != mesh_map_.end()) {
46  return *(it->second);
47  } else {
48  LOG(FATAL) << "Accessed unallocated mesh at " << index.transpose();
49  }
50  }
51 
52  inline typename Mesh::ConstPtr getMeshPtrByIndex(
53  const BlockIndex& index) const {
54  typename MeshMap::const_iterator it = mesh_map_.find(index);
55  if (it != mesh_map_.end()) {
56  return it->second;
57  } else {
58  LOG(WARNING) << "Returning null ptr to mesh!";
59  return typename Mesh::ConstPtr();
60  }
61  }
62 
63  inline typename Mesh::Ptr getMeshPtrByIndex(const BlockIndex& index) {
64  typename MeshMap::iterator it = mesh_map_.find(index);
65  if (it != mesh_map_.end()) {
66  return it->second;
67  } else {
68  LOG(WARNING) << "Returning null ptr to mesh!";
69  return typename Mesh::Ptr();
70  }
71  }
72 
73  // Gets a mesh by the mesh index it if already exists,
74  // otherwise allocates a new one.
75  inline typename Mesh::Ptr allocateMeshPtrByIndex(const BlockIndex& index) {
76  typename MeshMap::iterator it = mesh_map_.find(index);
77  if (it != mesh_map_.end()) {
78  return it->second;
79  } else {
80  return allocateNewBlock(index);
81  }
82  }
83 
84  inline typename Mesh::ConstPtr getMeshPtrByCoordinates(
85  const Point& coords) const {
86  return getMeshPtrByIndex(computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(coords));
87  }
88 
89  inline typename Mesh::Ptr getMeshPtrByCoordinates(const Point& coords) {
90  return getMeshPtrByIndex(computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(coords));
91  }
92 
93  // Gets a mesh by the coordinates it if already exists,
94  // otherwise allocates a new one.
95  inline typename Mesh::Ptr allocateMeshPtrByCoordinates(const Point& coords) {
96  return allocateMeshPtrByIndex(computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(coords));
97  }
98 
99  // Coord to mesh index.
100  inline BlockIndex computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(
101  const Point& coords) const {
102  return getGridIndexFromPoint<BlockIndex>(coords, block_size_inv_);
103  }
104 
105  // Pure virtual function -- inheriting class MUST overwrite.
106  typename Mesh::Ptr allocateNewBlock(const BlockIndex& index) {
107  auto insert_status = mesh_map_.insert(std::make_pair(
108  index, std::shared_ptr<Mesh>(new Mesh(
109  block_size_, index.cast<FloatingPoint>() * block_size_))));
110  DCHECK(insert_status.second)
111  << "Mesh already exists when allocating at " << index.transpose();
112  DCHECK(insert_status.first->second);
113  DCHECK_EQ(insert_status.first->first, index);
114  return insert_status.first->second;
115  }
116 
117  inline typename Mesh::Ptr allocateNewBlockByCoordinates(const Point& coords) {
118  return allocateNewBlock(computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(coords));
119  }
120 
121  void removeMesh(const BlockIndex& index) { mesh_map_.erase(index); }
122 
123  void removeMeshByCoordinates(const Point& coords) {
124  mesh_map_.erase(computeBlockIndexFromCoordinates(coords));
125  }
126 
127  void clearDistantMesh(const Point& center, const double max_distance) {
128  // we clear the mesh, but do not delete it from the map as the empty mesh
129  // must be sent to rviz so it is also cleared there
130  for (std::pair<const BlockIndex, typename Mesh::Ptr>& kv : mesh_map_) {
131  if ((kv.second->origin - center).squaredNorm() >
132  max_distance * max_distance) {
133  kv.second->clear();
134  kv.second->updated = true;
135  }
136  }
137  }
138 
139  void getAllAllocatedMeshes(BlockIndexList* meshes) const {
140  meshes->clear();
141  meshes->reserve(mesh_map_.size());
142  for (const std::pair<const BlockIndex, typename Mesh::Ptr>& kv :
143  mesh_map_) {
144  meshes->emplace_back(kv.first);
145  }
146  }
147 
148  void getAllUpdatedMeshes(BlockIndexList* meshes) const {
149  meshes->clear();
150  for (const std::pair<const BlockIndex, typename Mesh::Ptr>& kv :
151  mesh_map_) {
152  if (kv.second->updated) {
153  meshes->emplace_back(kv.first);
154  }
155  }
156  }
157 
158  // Get mesh from mesh layer. NOTE: The triangles and vertices in this mesh are
159  // distinct, hence, this will not produce a connected mesh.
160  void getMesh(Mesh* combined_mesh) const {
161  CHECK_NOTNULL(combined_mesh);
162 
163  // Combine everything in the layer into one giant combined mesh.
164 
165  BlockIndexList mesh_indices;
166  getAllAllocatedMeshes(&mesh_indices);
167 
168  // Check if color, normals and indices are enabled for the first non-empty
169  // mesh. If they are, they need to be enabled for all other ones as well.
170  bool has_colors = false;
171  bool has_normals = false;
172  bool has_indices = false;
173  if (!mesh_indices.empty()) {
174  for (const BlockIndex& block_index : mesh_indices) {
175  Mesh::ConstPtr mesh = getMeshPtrByIndex(block_index);
176  if (!mesh->vertices.empty()) {
177  has_colors = mesh->hasColors();
178  has_normals = mesh->hasNormals();
179  has_indices = mesh->hasTriangles();
180  break;
181  }
182  }
183  }
184 
185  // Loop again over all meshes to figure out how big the mesh needs to be.
186  size_t mesh_size = 0;
187  for (const BlockIndex& block_index : mesh_indices) {
188  Mesh::ConstPtr mesh = getMeshPtrByIndex(block_index);
189  mesh_size += mesh->vertices.size();
190  }
191 
192  // Reserve space for the mesh.
193  combined_mesh->reserve(mesh_size, has_normals, has_colors, has_indices);
194 
195  size_t new_index = 0u;
196  for (const BlockIndex& block_index : mesh_indices) {
197  Mesh::ConstPtr mesh = getMeshPtrByIndex(block_index);
198 
199  // Check assumption that all meshes have same configuration regarding
200  // colors, normals and indices.
201  if (!mesh->vertices.empty()) {
202  CHECK_EQ(has_colors, mesh->hasColors());
203  CHECK_EQ(has_normals, mesh->hasNormals());
204  CHECK_EQ(has_indices, mesh->hasTriangles());
205  }
206 
207  // Copy the mesh content into the combined mesh. This is done in triplets
208  // for readability only, as one loop iteration will then copy one
209  // triangle.
210  for (size_t i = 0; i < mesh->vertices.size(); i += 3, new_index += 3) {
211  CHECK_LT(new_index + 2, mesh_size);
212 
213  combined_mesh->vertices.push_back(mesh->vertices[i]);
214  combined_mesh->vertices.push_back(mesh->vertices[i + 1]);
215  combined_mesh->vertices.push_back(mesh->vertices[i + 2]);
216 
217  if (has_colors) {
218  combined_mesh->colors.push_back(mesh->colors[i]);
219  combined_mesh->colors.push_back(mesh->colors[i + 1]);
220  combined_mesh->colors.push_back(mesh->colors[i + 2]);
221  }
222  if (has_normals) {
223  combined_mesh->normals.push_back(mesh->normals[i]);
224  combined_mesh->normals.push_back(mesh->normals[i + 1]);
225  combined_mesh->normals.push_back(mesh->normals[i + 2]);
226  }
227  if (has_indices) {
228  combined_mesh->indices.push_back(new_index);
229  combined_mesh->indices.push_back(new_index + 1);
230  combined_mesh->indices.push_back(new_index + 2);
231  }
232  }
233  }
234 
235  // Verify combined mesh.
236  if (combined_mesh->hasColors()) {
237  CHECK_EQ(combined_mesh->vertices.size(), combined_mesh->colors.size());
238  }
239  if (combined_mesh->hasNormals()) {
240  CHECK_EQ(combined_mesh->vertices.size(), combined_mesh->normals.size());
241  }
242 
243  CHECK_EQ(combined_mesh->vertices.size(), combined_mesh->indices.size());
244  }
245 
246  // Get a connected mesh by merging close vertices and removing triangles with
247  // zero surface area. If you only would like to connect vertices, make sure
248  // that the proximity threhsold <<< voxel size. If you would like to simplify
249  // the mesh, chose a threshold greater or near the voxel size until you
250  // reached the level of simpliciation desired.
251  void getConnectedMesh(
252  Mesh* connected_mesh,
253  const FloatingPoint approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold =
254  1e-10) const {
255  BlockIndexList mesh_indices;
256  getAllAllocatedMeshes(&mesh_indices);
257 
258  AlignedVector<Mesh::ConstPtr> meshes;
259  meshes.reserve(mesh_indices.size());
260  for (const BlockIndex& block_index : mesh_indices) {
261  meshes.push_back(getMeshPtrByIndex(block_index));
262  }
263 
264  createConnectedMesh(meshes, connected_mesh,
265  approximate_vertex_proximity_threshold);
266  }
267 
268  size_t getNumberOfAllocatedMeshes() const { return mesh_map_.size(); }
269  // Deletes ALL parts of the mesh.
270  void clear() { mesh_map_.clear(); }
271 
272  FloatingPoint block_size() const { return block_size_; }
273 
274  FloatingPoint block_size_inv() const { return block_size_inv_; }
275 
276  private:
277  FloatingPoint block_size_;
278 
279  // Derived types.
280  FloatingPoint block_size_inv_;
281 
282  MeshMap mesh_map_;
283 };
284 
285 } // namespace voxblox
